body: So, what if we extend the current exception to `ClientWebSocketHandshakeException` and add `HttpResponse` field and `ServerWebSocketHandshakeException` with `HttpRequest` and provide additional hint `AbortingType` like INVALID_RESPONSE_STATUS, INVALID_CONNECTION_HEADER,... and other by https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6455#section-4.2.2. WDYT @normanmaurer, @slandelle ?
@amizurov I am a bit hesitant as this may also put the burden of reference counting on the user.

> @amizurov I am a bit hesitant as this may also put the burden of reference counting on the user.

I mean only `DefaultHttpResponse` and `DefaultHttpRequest` without body, in most of case it will be enough.

From my perspective it will be sufficient just to bypass a separate field in exception the information which is already present in it's exception message, just to avoid parsing strings.
But I agree with @amizurov  that whole meta-information (like headers) will cover more use cases.
From other perspective I don't find similar tickets here, and not sure whether someone need any information, which is not provided in message.
In any case I can contribute this improvement if it will be welcomed.
WDYT @normanmaurer  ?

Hi, guys added some related links according this discussion
 
- #4528 (i think this is first mention about problem)

- https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-gateway/issues/1884 (similar to our case)

issue.title: Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header is not passed to proxied server

repository.name: spring-cloud-gateway
repository.description: An API Gateway built on Spring Framework and Spring Boot providing routing and more.

issue.body:
Expected behavior: proxied server should receive the `Sec-WebSocket-Extensions` header. 

Current behavior:
Configure gateway route for handling websocket connection. Client send request ->
 ```
        GET /ws HTTP/1.1
        Host: localhost:7788
        Upgrade: websocket
        Connection: Upgrade
        Sec-WebSocket-Key: dGhlIHNhbXBsZSBub25jZQ==
        Sec-WebSocket-Extensions: permessage-deflate; client_max_window_bits
        Sec-WebSocket-Version: 13
```
Proxied server not received ` Sec-WebSocket-Extensions` header. This is header was filtered in `WebsocketRoutingFilter.class`.

Spring Cloud Gateway Version: 2.1.2.RELEASE

issue.title: Provide access to HTTP response status and headers when error occurs during websocket upgrade

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
I would like access to the HTTP response status and headers when an error response is returned from the server during websocket upgrade.

Currently, when the websocket upgrade response indicates the upgrade failed, netty throws a `WebSocketHandshakeException` with a message indicating the problem.  However, the exception does not provide access to the HTTP response status/headers.

https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/69b44c6d06d4449920b6b8990b0f6e0473f3532b/codec-http/src/main/java/io/netty/handler/codec/http/websocketx/WebSocketClientHandshaker13.java#L273-L291


A concrete use case where providing clients access to the response status/headers would be useful is when an OAuth 2.0 bearer token is used for authentication.  The server will return a 401 response if the token is invalid, and will provide additional details in the `WWW-Authenticate` header.  (See [RFC-6750 Section 3](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750#section-3)).  If the headers indicate that the token has expired, then clients can act upon it to remove the token from its cache, retrieve a new token, and then retry the websocket connection.    Currently this is not possible, since the `WebSocketHandshakeException` does not provide access to the response status/headers.

### Expected behavior

Able to access Websocket upgrade HTTP response status and headers when websocket upgrades fail.

### Actual behavior

A `WebSocketHandshakeException` is thrown, with a message indicating why the failure occurred.  The `WebSocketHandshakeException` does not currently provide access to the http response status and headers.

### Steps to reproduce

Issue a websocket upgrade request to a server that returns a 401 response.

### Netty version

4.1.52

issue.title: Provide new client and server websocket handshake exceptions

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

At the moment we have only one base `WebSocketHandshakeException` for handling WebSocket upgrade issues.
Unfortunately, this message contains only a string message about the cause of the failure, which is inconvenient in handling.

Modification:

Provide new `WebSocketClientHandshakeException` with `HttpResponse` field  and `WebSocketServerHandshakeException` with `HttpRequest` field both of them without content for avoid reference counting 
problems. 

Result:

More information for more flexible handling.

Fixes #10277 #4528 #10639.
